title: Martin Whitman Buys Three New Stakes
text:
Martin Whitman Buys Three New Stakes By GuruFocus.com 27 minutes ago  Content preferences Done 
Martin Whitman ( Trades , Portfolio ), founder and portfolio manager of the Third Avenue Value Fund, is known as a "buy and hold" value investor. He looks for businesses he understands that have strong finances and effective management with shares that are selling below intrinsic value. This Powerful Chart Made Peter Lynch 29% A Year For 13 Years 
The performance of Third Avenue Value Fund suggests that his strategy is a sound one. In 2014, it recorded returns of 4.88%. In 2013, returns were nearly four times better than that (18.84%) and, in 2012, they were even better (27.48%). 
Whitman invested in three new stakes in the second quarter - PNC Financial Services Group Inc (PNC), Masco Corp (MAS) and Kingfisher PLC ( KGF.L ). 
PNC Financial Services is a Pittsburgh-based financial services corporation with assets exceeding $345 billion. Whitman purchased a 479,200-share stake in PNC, paying an average price of $94.56 per share. The investment had a 2.38% impact on Whitman's portfolio. 
PNC has a market cap of $50.26 billion and an enterprise value of $70.96 billion. It has a P/E of 13.4, a Price/Book of 1.1 and a Price/Sales of 3.4. Masco is a Michigan-based maker of home improvement products. Whitman bought a 1,479,930-share stake in the company for an average price of $23.18 per share. The transaction had a 2.13% impact on Whitman's portfolio. 
Masco has a market cap of $8.18 billion and an enterprise value of $10.52 billion. It has a P/E of 9.9, a Price/Book of 10.7 and a Price/Sales of 1.0. Kingfisher is a London-based home improvement retailer. Whitman acquired a 3,672,276-share stake in Kingfisher for an average price of �3.55 (about $5.56 in U.S. money) per share. That purchase had a 1.07% impact on Whitman's portfolio. 
Kingfisher has a market cap of $8.19 billion and an enterprise value of $8.08 billion. It has a P/E of 15.0, a Price/Book of 1.4 and a Price/Sales of 0.8. Causeway International Value (Trades, Portfolio) and Invesco European Growth Fund (Trades, Portfolio) have shares of Kingfisher in their portfolios. View gallery . 
Whitman also added to four existing stakes in the second quarter - Canfor Corp ( CFP.TO ), Weyerhaeuser Co (WY), Brookdale Senior Living Inc (BKD) and General Motors Co (GM). 
Canfor is a Vancouver-based forest products company. Whitman purchased 523,000 shares for an average price of $25.17 per share. The deal had a 0.56% impact on Whitman's portfolio. 
Canfor has a market cap of $3.65 billion and an enterprise value of $4.23 billion. It has a P/E of 23.7, a Price/Book of 2.8 and a Price/Sales of 1.1. View gallery . 
Weyerhaeuser is a Washington state-based forest products company. Whitman added 251,500 shares to his existing stake, making it the eighth largest (by volume) in his portfolio. Whitman paid an average price of $33.64 per share; the deal had a 0.43% impact on his portfolio. 
Weyerhaeuser has a market cap of $16.54 billion and an enterprise value of $20.8 billion. It has a P/E of 10.3, a Price/Book of 3.3 and a Price/Sales of 2.4. Brookdale Senior Living is a Tennessee-based senior residence operator. Whitman bought 150,500 shares for an average price of $37.18 per share. The transaction had a 0.3% impact on his portfolio. 
Brookdale Senior Living has a market cap of $6.47 billion and an enterprise value of $12.75 billion. It has a Price/Book of 2.3 and a Price/Sales of 1.3. General Motors is a Detroit-based automotive company. Whitman purchased 92,700 shares for an average price of $35.67 per share. The acquisition had a 0.18% impact on his portfolio.

Whitman sold out two stakes in the second quarter - Daiwa Securities Group Inc (TSE:8601) and Target Corp (TGT). 
Daiwa Securities Group is a Tokyo-based securities brokerage. Whitman sold his 5,438,700-share stake for an average price of �7.81 (about $0.06 in American dollars) per share. The transaction had a -2.1% impact on his portfolio. 
Daiwa Securities Group has a market cap of $1.6 trillion and an enterprise value of $10 trillion. It has a P/E of 10.7, a Price/Book of 1.3 and a Price/Sales of 3.0. David Herro (Trades, Portfolio) has shares of Daiwa in his portfolio. View gallery . 
Target is a Minnesota-based retailer. Whitman sold his 484,705-share stake in the company for an average price of $79.48 per share. The sale had a -1.9% impact on his portfolio. 
Target has a market cap of $52.99 billion and an enterprise value of $62.99 billion. It has a Price/Book of 3.8 and a Price/Sales of 0.7. Whitman also sold portions of his stakes in 12 companies, among them KeyCorp (KEY), Toyota Industries Corporation (TSE:6201), Wheelock and Co Ltd (HKSE:00020), Hang Lung Group Ltd (HKSE:00010) and Michelin ( ML.PA ).
